reviewText: This game. Oh boy this game. Just don't even bother. Simple as that. Here is why...\nIt is broken. The mouse controls are just down right broken. I could only continue playing this because I have an xbox controller to plug in. Even then this game is barely playable. The physics...who programed these physics, they make no sense. Was no effort put into making this? When you roll down a hill, hit another hill GOING THE OPPOSITE WAY, you somehow gain speed and keep going up. This can be level breaking in some levels in which you have to stop or you will fall off.\nThe first chapter has 30 levels and the second chapter has 9. Did they forget how to count? Why the sudden change? I am still trying to finish the game 100% and so I do not know how many levels are in the final third Event" but at this rate it should be around 3. It seems that as the game development progressed the just completely gave up. Speaking of giving up on design
date: there are a few levels that made me laugh. Some are so badly designed... but 2-8 comes to mind. Which is it devs: slow down the hill OR avoid bolders. You can barely do both. Not to mention that gem at the start of the track makes me laugh. Really a gem under the track? Was there a misclick when level editing? If you slow down to get it (it just randomly gets absorbed up the drivers ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• if you are slow enough) or flip over to get it
hoursPlayed: you will not make it down the first hill. Which is the first obstacle of the level. Why not shift over that track under the first hill a bit to the right? You can barely land on it. If you slow down to do that you will get hit by the boulders
voteText: which are btw REALLY closed together in drop time. Ugh. *Facepalms*\nThe ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing gems. Half my playtime is me idling as I rub my temples and breathe in and out slowly
helpfulPercent: and me redoing levels because the hitbox radius on the vehicle is ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing broken.  I have literally passed over collectable gems
votesHelpful: they have entered my pixelated body
votesTotal: and then they have quickly shot out of my ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• for no apparent reason. This can cause you to redo levels just because a gem decided that this day wasn't its day to be collected.\nThe art. Is it art? I am getting a bit sick of pixelated games on steam. Some are really well done and beautifuly made. Most aren't. And it is starting to get to me. This is 2014 there is no need to pixelate your game to make it seem retro. Specially if you are awful at pixel art. This game looks like mario had too much to drink and then vomited. The devs then took his pixelated puke and used that as art. The colors and contrast are bad. there is no sense of a color palette. Every pixel just blends in together and it is very hard to focus on things. There is no form of siloutte on the player
commentsCount: and the background. It looks like a free flash game on Newgrounds that gets maximum 2/5 stars. The UI is pretty funny. When I tell you that a word is greyed out
column16: you would think that means locked or unclickable right? Nope grey words are the main thigns you click on. White words are...I am not even sure. Just info and random words on the side. It took me a while to know what was going on with the UI because there is so much going on in the background that all the pixels just kind of blend together. The MAIN menu is simple but everythign beyond that is laughably bad.\nSpeaking of the main menu
column17: just sit there and watch. The main menu tells you how bad this game is. Watch the drivers. 9/10 don't make it over the fist gap. When they don't even put effort into a simple track in the main menu
column18: you should get an idea of what is to come in the actual levels.\nAnyway I could honestly go on and on about how awful this game is. And in case you are wondering I am only finishing it and playing it because I enjoy finishing bad games and the achievements are fairly easy. I will say that the amount of customization on the driver IS nice but the pixel art
column20: is so god awful that there is no sense of visual satisfaction when you change your driver and cart gear.\nThe amount of customization and the gem bank mechanic where collectables turn into usable money is pretty good. But everything else sucks. Therefore my final thoughts are: This game is broken

reviewText:
So in general this game is a solid concept. However, there are a few issues with this game.

1. There are levels that are very difficult to beat, with a mouse.
2. The game is a swipe game that uses the mouse as a controller input.
3. As a result of 2, we end up with the problems associated with 1, leading to a very difficult game as it is difficult to accurately control the speed of the cart.

Devs, take note this is NOT how you port a game from a touch screen to the PC platform.

Cons-Mouse controls are awkward As suggested by the title of the game, you have to swipe in this game... With a mouse. Sounds like an alright idea for a mobile game.... I'm not going to go any further about the controls are terrible.

-It's just not fun. It just plainly isn't. After 1.1 hrs of searching for some form of entertainment I could not find anything.

Overrall:A cancerous game that is not worth your time. I got it for free but I still have strong opinions that this game is as bad as a diseased fish. Not diseased in a metaphorical way but diseased as in, this game actually went and swum into an underwater druggie hangout and took one of the needles and injected it into himself, giving him hepatitus C (or hepatitus Sea for that matter). C is also a better rating than what I will give this game because it is most certainly elementary.

2/10

reviewText:
This just barely gets a recommendation -- and only if you have a controller to play it with. The game is in my opinion unplayable with mouse controls. If you do not have a controller - skip it.

Swipecart is not an action game - it is a physics puzzle game. You control a minecart which you give speed at the start, then strategically slow down on the actual tracks in order to not fall to your death.
Each level can be played either for maximum speed, or getting all gems, and these two are tracked separately.

Play this windowed as it does not look good in fullscreen on a large monitor. But if you can get past these problems, you're left with a decent game to waste a few idle minutes with, and the presence of online leaderboards keeps you primed to try and do better.
voteText: 15 of 22 people (68%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Swipecart a game that came from phones, that should have stayed on phones, because most people don't have a touchscreen (TS for short) option on their monitors.

Graphics - Mediocre, not pleasent on the eyes if you are playing for a long period of time. 2/10

Music - The only good part about this game, especialy if you have a bass system. Still not worth getting the game only for its music. 4/10

Cinematics and Story - None

Content - A few levels and a level editor, yay (still not worth it) 3/10

Controls - Only if you have a TS monitor, and yes I know the game can be beaten without a TS monitor, but be my guest, It is really hard the normal way, bonus note I am a bad player (take whatever you want from that). 0/10

Gameplay - Stiff and downright bad. 2/10

Do yourself good and don't even think about getting this game, it is not worth it, Be right back, going to check it out on the phone.....yea don't buy it even there, just forget this game even existed.

Final Score: 2.2/10

reviewText: Basically what you do in this game is you move the mouse cursor back and forth to gain momentum before you cross the start line. As soon as you cross the start line you can no longer increase your speed, you can only break. The objective is to come to a full stop at the finish line.\nThis game was made for smartphone and then ported to PC, so graphics quality is bad. Perhaps this game is fun on a smartphone, I wouldn't know. What I do know is that it's no fun at all on PC. It's boring.

reviewText:
I would if I could...totally recommend this game, however it can give me serious rages on some maps. The main reason for this review is to establish that anyone who has a short temper should NOT play this game unless they don't play it on a PC.

It has really awful control of the breaks and wheelies...it makes some maps impossible to get with gold medal and perfect gems even though you played it right (unless you do it like 30-50 times until you get it perfect).
So...as a conclusion, when they'll update the controls (which after all...are one of the bases for a game), I would totally recommend the game for thrill seekers and stubborn people who like challenges.

reviewText:
This game was obviously a terrible attempt at making a quick buck
-It's a port of a mobile game, never a good sign
-Very simple options:turn audio off and resolution(only in windows mode)

-Highly unintuitive menu design that took me a while to figure out
-Terrible physics
-Gets repetitive fast
-For some reason all 'k's are capitalized
-The text format often breaks
-Servers are never online
-The music is all blatantly stolen songs that are just made 8-bit"

0/10 would buy bad rats instead"

reviewText:
Swipecart is a mobile game ported to PC, you only use the mouse to play. And the fun starts here already... The controls are totally non-intuitive, unless clicking and dragging your mouse to the right continously to gain speed is normal to you... You can CLEARLY see that this game was not intended to be on a PC.

Ok... Now for the game itself... It is a fun and super simple little game, something you would expect from a mobile game, but widhout P2W aspects. I think that I would enjoy this game if the controls didn't suck.

Your goal is to get to the end of the level and stand in the finish line for some seconds, you do this by speeding up, braking, boosting (aka flying across the whole stage), making ollies, and some possible other movements that I didn't play enough to unlock.

Also you can buy clothes for your driver and change your minecart.

Bad stuff and bad stu... I mean... Good stuff
+Retro graphics
+Minimal customization
+Map editor
+I got this for free on a massive giveaway and it gave me cards
-CONTROLS
-IT'S ANOTHER ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ING BAD PORT AWUM√áTM OUWTMIOWYWEIHTN EWTHLIWH

So that's it, don't buy it. Use your money to get a lunch at school, I'm sure it will be more lucrative.

reviewText: Swipecart is a mobile game that should have stayed mobile.  As far as I know, the idea's original, and the execution's not bad, but this direct port makes it painfully obvious that the game was designed for a touchscreen device.  Not only do the controls feel awkward with a mouse, I found that scrolling in level selection is outright broken, making it so only the first few levels can be selected.  Having gotten it for free, I don't regret giving it a try, but I wouldn't want to continue with it even if I could, and I can't recommend it (as a PC game).

reviewText:
I got this game for free and as such hate to leave a neg review, however the fact that ¬£1.99 is being asked for this game on steam I feel that it is fair to do so. This game belongs on Google Play or iTunes as a free to play ad supported game only.

To be fair and honest I could not make a game like this, I have ever only made mods and maps etc for existing games and as such tip my hat to the person / people that made this.

The music is mind meltingly annoying.
The controls are more luck than skill.
The pysics are, well at times too random to use any skill.
I get the whole pixel graphics thing and that is fine but they could still be better.

In short a casual game that is fun for a few levels and infuriating beyond that. There are so many cheap excellent games in steam sales on a regular basis, as such I just can not find reason why anyone would buy this.

However if its avail on a tablet ad supported for free then give it a go, would definatly make a train journey pass in no time, but you definatly will not feel relaxed when you get there, you will be lucky if you haven't broken your tablet in half.

Almost forgot, in 73mins of game play, game locked up 3 or 4 times once had to restart the game other times cleared itself within a min, has some stability issues.

reviewText:
First of all, this game is a phone port, or something with a touch screen.
It's an indie game, don't expect an over the top product.

Anyway, there's quite a few pros and cons with this game, and I actually found it to be a fun little time waster. It isn't a game I would buy at full price, but if you can get it with a discount it's worth the money

In total, I'd give about a 6/10 as far as indie games go.

Pros:
Steam cards (If you grab it in a sale, you make money, everyone loves money)

The cards are worth more than I expected

Leaderboard, to try to beat the scores of other players

A level creator, which I always find to be a neat feature

The physics actually work, I've seen those go straight to hell in other games

The game is actually enjoyable, if you've got a taste for these type of things

It's actually NOT a horrible port, the controls work once you understand them, and if you don't want to use your mouse?

BAM we have full controller support, which does complement the game much better than the mouse. (Except the
controls went a little haywire but I'll get to that in a moment.)

The game increases in difficulty really quickly, this can be a pro or a con depending on what you like in a game, if you're seeking a nice, relaxing physics racer where you don't have to think much, this isn't for you.


Cons:

The mouse can stop working entirely in the menu, and there's nothing you can do but spam click and hope it works.

The game can be a little confusing at times, but that comes with the territory.

(This is nitpicking and didn't lose any points in my book) But at times it'll tell you to tap the screen, instead of use the mouse, which I'm sure is left over from the mobile version.

English is the only supported language, which makes it difficult for players who speak other languages. (But a lot of games are like that, so again I'm nitpicking)


All in all, the pros outweigh the cons in my eyes, making this game not nearly as horrible as people say. If you're up for a physics racer with a high difficulty, this is the game for you.

reviewText:
Originally a mobile game, yes, but still pretty fun for the price.  It looks nice at high resolutions, and even has controller support.

The gameplay is really simple so you can jump right in and get racing.  The game also lends itself very well to playing in short sessions; you can load up a track or two, then get back to work.

If you have a mobile device, it's probably a little better designed for that, but it's definitely playable on PC.  It's not without issues, but for $4 there's quite a bit of game here.  Fun little distraction.

reviewText:
This game is actually much better than you'd expect. It's essentially a 2D physics game that gives you one opportunity to accelerate, after which you can only break. Using these options you must navigate some rather bizarre track situations while stopping at the end without falling off the track at any point.

The only problem with it is that it suffers from the fact that it's obviously a port" (or perhaps just build) of a game designed for mobile touch screen platforms. I feel like it could really use some sort of adaptation for playing it with the mouse (or other non-touchscreen controls).

Note: I got this in a game bundle. I'm not sure I'd pay more than $1 for it
date: even though I'd say it's pretty good for what it is."

reviewText:
Name: SwipecartDeveloper: Micro Factory Games
Date: 2014
Category: Trash
Genre: Fictional Sport
Orientation: Singleplayer
Perspective: 2D - Side-Scrolling
Timeflow: Match-Based, Fast-Paced
Setting: Modern
Style: Pixel Art
Tags: Cross-Platform, Indie, No Story, Physics-Based
Model: B2P
Content: Solid
Platforms: PC, Android, iOS
Review:
Fictional sport pixel game in which you ride a mine cart. By riding" developers mean clicking 2 buttons AT START of the race and then watching how your mine cart goes through level hoping it will stop exactly at mine entrance (finish point).
There is also garage where you can buy cosmetics like shiny wheels or helmet of different color. And a carrier mode with exciting tournaments and golden cups.
Overall
date: terrible port of terrible android game.\nOh and yeah
recommended: there is a level editor! Go ahead guys
hoursPlayed:
create your own tracks.
Class: I - Sh*t
Verdict: No
Reviewed: 8.23.2015
Approach: Steam - PC
Time: Several Minutes
Deeds:
1 Achievement"
votesTotal: 4 of 13 people (31%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
As an avid Gamer, I enjoyed the thrills and non-stop frustration brought on by the customize-able cart in Swipecart!
Throughout each level I found myself mashing the restart, letting all hope go that my little lady would make it, and not indeed plummet to her untimely death.
Seeing the passion put into this game, the fun comes through naturally.
There is a full shop of unlock-able items to truly give your rider a personalized feel!
My favorite is the very familiar flower-power van! ;) Paired with a sweet flower helmet of course!

Overall I have to admit Swipecart will keep me coming back, if not for the vast obstacle range through all three worlds, then it will be just to check in on the shop restock!

reviewText: A bad game with an even worse port from a mobile version. I played it on XBox pc gamepad cause keyboard/mouse is unplayable. Bad physics, horrible control system, bad navigation in menus, pixels that hurt, twitchy rails and lousy concept. So you accelerate for a small portion of a track and then spend the rest of time braking, doing wheelies and using other boosts - but you either need to try to get the gold medal (speed) or gem (for collecting all the gems). And all of that just to buy/get vanity stuff - helms, carts and wheels. Wow. so.much.nothing\nI played for 45 mins only cause that is the time that was needed to get my 3 cards, tnx for that.

reviewText:
I actually enjoyed this game. There isn't a whole lot to it but to me it felt like a really simple Grand Tourismo or Forza Motorsports game. Having the same basic features like completing time trials unlocking items and vehicles, and 1 or 2 other basic concepts...
Like I said there isn't a whole lot too this. However the levels are challenging. The soundtrack is pretty good for being 8-bit (seriously bravo on the music). You try to do the tracks in the best time and you can compare your time with other players online (probably one of the best things about this game). Also the game offers Steam trading cards and how can you be upset with picking up a few trading cards?
All in all I'd give this game a 7.5 out of 10.
Ok I gtg... Writing this review is making me want to play it again.

reviewText: A bad game with an even worse port from a mobile version. I played it on XBox pc gamepad cause keyboard/mouse is unplayable. Bad physics, horrible control system, bad navigation in menus, pixels that hurt, twitchy rails and lousy concept. So you accelerate for a small portion of a track and then spend the rest of time braking, doing wheelies and using other boosts - but you either need to try to get the gold medal (speed) or gem (for collecting all the gems). And all of that just to buy/get vanity stuff - helms, carts and wheels. Wow. so.much.nothing\nI played for 45 mins only cause that is the time that was needed to get my 3 cards, tnx for that.

reviewText:
And this, everyone, is the reason you don't install the games you get for free. I'm not even sure where to begin. Other than of course don't ever part ways with your money for this. Don't even play it if you do get it for free. If you get it for free, don't even gift it to anyone. Don't be that much of a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. Just lose this game somewhere. If we pretend it doesn't exist we can surely defeat it.

¬£1.99? I'd rather stick one pound coin, three 20 pence coins, two 5 pence pieces, a 10p and twenty nine 1p coins up my wonderhole.

And those good" reviews down there
date: you see 'em? Yeah. For the Android version of the game. Not this awful port. God I hate this game so much."

reviewText: I'm sorry. I really can't see what's good about this game on a pc. Maybe simple on an android, but the resposive time on the cart as well as some of the tracks make this a pretty bad game. I would not spend more than $0 on this game. This is fairly bad quality in both content, graphics, and mechanics even if it were a simple flash game online. Sure it's a neat idea and entertaining, but not for very long. It's not worth the frustration to complete the levels much less the achievements.

reviewText: First off, this game is very repetitive and a very obvious mobile port. The controls are pretty awful if I'm being honest. In order to gain speed, you have to slide your mouse back and forth over your minecart, which is very awkward and difficult to do consistently. This may work better with a finger on a touch screen, but not with a mouse.\n\nSecondly, the game's menus are confusing. I spent several minutes trying to find out how to get back to the level select. You can't just click on the name of the world that you want to visit; instead, there's this hidden button under the title that looks like it is part of stats. It says something like stages cleared: 4/30"
date: and you can only click on the word "stages."\n\nThis game may have some redemption from the ability to design your own levels
recommended: but I did not have the patience or drive to even bother.\n\nMaybe buy this for your iPhone or Android
hoursPlayed: but don't bother with it on Steam."
voteText: August 31, 2015

reviewText: Been going through games in my library and playing all of them. I almost got to the end of this game until I got to the levels that were in hell, and it's a good location for them because they are hell to play. This has easily been the most frustrating game I have ever played. The controls are awful. It's called swipecart, everything requires you to swipe. Thats great for a touchscreen but not a mouse, especially when two abilities use pretty much the same swipe direction. There's also no need for skill in this game. You pretty much swipe at the beginning of the level and then pray that you're gonna end up in the right place. 2/10 - one of the worst games I have played.
